title: Bank Card type
content:
What is the type used on bank cards for the number, etc.   
   
Thankyou
author: jonathanlawley

comments.content: Oh, sorry. I thought he meant checks. I'm so old school sometimes. :-)

How about this free font called "halter" ?   
   
 [http://www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nq=1&q=halter&Submit=+Go+](http://web.archive.org/web/20100502015217/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nq=1&q=halter&Submit=%2BGo%2B)

Halter is clearly refrenced from bank card type, but it is not the type used.   
   
My British card infact uses one type for the card number and another the the expiry date etc. Any ideas?   
   
 ![The two different types](http://web.archive.org/web/20100502015217im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23869.jpg)

now bank cards... What is this, Forgery Central?!   
   
Ohh brother.

That's weird. I just checked mine and all type on both   
my (Belgian) bank cards and my Visa is set in [OCR-B](http://web.archive.org/web/20100502015217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/ocr-b/),   
while the card number on my Visa is an unidentified   
face that looks a bit like simplified [OCR-A](http://web.archive.org/web/20100502015217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/ocr-a/).   
   
Two days ago an ID request for [American passports](http://web.archive.org/web/20100502015217/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23622.html?1073612505),   
now bank cards... What is this, Forgery Central?!   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100502015217im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
